metadata.synopsis: The battle has ended with all the Smugglers dead. The Attacker Leader Farlin must have survived.

19.speaker: Farlin
19.text: Scurry off back to the streets now.

49.speaker: Farlin
49.text: You did good, stranger. Some would have tried to slink away rather than get involved.
49.context: NodeContext: Clearly a little too into the bloody combat she has just won

39.speaker: Farlin
39.text: They wouldn't earn the gratitude of the Guild.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I don't particularly want gratitude from criminals.

17.speaker: Farlin
17.text: The real criminals are the patriars slapping each other on the back in Wyrm's Rock while the people die in the streets.

20.speaker: Farlin
20.text: The Guild keeps order - and looks out for the little man.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Really? Does anyone actually believe that?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Are you going to pay me for helping clean up this scum?

57.speaker: Farlin
57.text: Of course - the Guild always rewards good work.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Happy to help - who did we just kill?

30.speaker: Farlin
30.text: A new flavour of scum that's been muscling in on our business.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Stone Lord? Never heard of him.

31.speaker: Farlin
31.text: He's a newcomer to our delightful underworld. And he doesn't play nice with others.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I heard the Stone Lord's name from a dying man. Who is he?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Let me guess - some kind of golem crime boss?

35.speaker: Farlin
35.text: Nobody actually knows. Word is he's big, dense, tough as rocks.

24.speaker: Farlin
24.text: But human. We think. And definitely ruthless.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What were his agents doing here?

46.speaker: Farlin
46.text: We think the Stone Lord and his cronies are in league with the Absolute cultists. This little operation here certainly suggests so.

16.speaker: Farlin
16.text: They were shifting something valuable by boat. But that something belongs to the Guild now.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I deserve a little something for helping you.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'll leave you to your spoils then. Goodbye.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Surely he can't stand against the Guild?

34.speaker: Farlin
34.text: We think he's in league with the Absolute cultists. This little operation here certainly suggests so.

44.speaker: Farlin
44.text: The Guild always wins in the end. But this Stone Lord is trouble.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I deserve a little something for helping protect your operations.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Thanks for the tip - I'll bear that in mind. Goodbye.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: So am I - I'll be taking everything.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I don't play nice with others either - time to die.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I reckon I deserve a reward for killing his agents.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'm rather ruthless too. Time to die.

21.speaker: Farlin
21.text: Traitorous little guttersnipe - I'll cut you to offal!

27.speaker: Farlin
27.text: He is. Nobody has actually seen him, but word is he's tough as rocks, and ruthless as an ettin.

48.speaker: Farlin
48.text: One usually follows the other. Here you go.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Who did I just kill to earn that coin?
